question_stem.en:
A 63-year-old man comes to the office due to fatigue and easy bruising. He has no lymphadenopathy on physical examination. Laboratory results are as follows:

Complete blood count
Hemoglobin 8.0 g/dL
Platelets 40,000/mm³
Leukocytes 20,500/mm³

The patient's peripheral blood smear is shown in the image below {{exhibit_1}}:
question_stem.zh:
一名63岁男性因疲劳和易于瘀伤前来就诊。体格检查未见淋巴结肿大。实验室检查结果如下：

全血细胞计数
血红蛋白 8.0 g/dL
血小板 40,000/mm³
白细胞 20,500/mm³

患者的外周血涂片见下图 {{exhibit_1}}:

question.en: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question.zh: 以下哪项是最可能的诊断？

G.zh: 传染性单核细胞增多症

explanation.en:
This patient's peripheral blood smear shows very large nucleated cells (see red cell size for comparison) with scant cytoplasm. These are blast cells, the finding of which makes acute leukemia likely. Closer examination of the smear reveals linear, purple-red inclusions in some of the cells, called Auer rods {{exhibit_2}}. These represent fused granules and may be single or multiple within immature myeloid precursors. Auer rods are highly suggestive of ACUTE MYELOID LEUKEMIA (AML) but not of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) (Choice A). Although Auer rods are most commonly associated with the M1, M2, and M3 subtypes of AML, they may be found in any type of AML.

The vast majority of AML cases occur in adults, with a median age of 65 and median white blood cell count of about 15,000/mm³ at diagnosis. Most patients present with complications of pancytopenia [eg, fatigue from anemia, bruising/bleeding from thrombocytopenia, infection from functional neutropenia (despite leukocytosis)]. Diagnostic criteria generally require the presence of ≥20% myeloblasts in the bone marrow or peripheral blood.

(Choices C and D) Chronic leukemia causes a prevalence of mature cells in the peripheral blood. In chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), peripheral smears usually show many mature granulocytes and few blasts (generally <2%). In chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), smears show many mature lymphocytes.

(Choice E) Patients with hairy cell leukemia have splenomegaly, cytopenias, and circulating hairy cells. On peripheral blood smear, hairy cells take the appearance of small- to medium-sized lymphoid cells with circumferential "hairy" projections {{exhibit_3}}.

(Choice F) Patients with Hodgkin lymphoma generally present with a mass (eg, mediastinal mass, enlarged lymph nodes). The finding of circulating neoplastic cells is extremely rare. Histologically, Reed-Sternberg cells are characteristic. These are large cells with abundant basophilic cytoplasm and ≥2 nuclear lobes or nuclei {{exhibit_4}}.

(Choice G) Patients with infectious mononucleosis have fatigue, lymphadenopathy, and splenomegaly. Thrombocytopenia can be a complication of this infection. Peripheral blood smear will show few circulating atypical lymphocytes, not numerous blasts {{exhibit_5}}.

Educational objective:
The finding of Auer rods (linear purple-red inclusions within immature myeloid precursors) is helpful in making the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia. Auer rods are not found in acute lymphoblastic leukemia. In chronic myeloid leukemia, there are more mature cells and fewer blasts {{exhibit_6}}. {{exhibit_7}}
explanation.zh:
该患者的外周血涂片显示非常大的有核细胞（参见红细胞大小进行比较），胞质稀少。这些是原始细胞，这一发现提示可能患有急性白血病。仔细观察涂片，可见一些细胞内有线状、紫红色的包涵体，称为 Auer 小体 {{exhibit_2}}。这些代表融合的颗粒，在未成熟的髓细胞前体中可能是单个或多个。 Auer 小体高度提示急性髓细胞白血病（AML），但不支持急性淋巴细胞白血病（ALL）（选项 A）。虽然 Auer 小体最常见于 AML 的 M1、M2 和 M3 亚型，但它们可能存在于任何类型的 AML 中。

绝大多数 AML 病例发生在成年人中，诊断时的中位年龄为 65 岁，中位白细胞计数约为 15,000/mm³。大多数患者表现为全血细胞减少症的并发症 [例如，贫血引起的疲劳、血小板减少症引起的瘀伤/出血、功能性中性粒细胞减少症引起的感染（尽管有白细胞增多症）]。诊断标准通常需要骨髓或外周血中存在 ≥20% 的成髓细胞。

（选项 C 和 D）慢性白血病导致外周血中成熟细胞的患病率增加。在慢性髓细胞白血病（CML）中，外周血涂片通常显示许多成熟的粒细胞和少量原始细胞（通常 <2%）。在慢性淋巴细胞白血病（CLL）中，涂片显示许多成熟的淋巴细胞。

（选项 E）毛细胞白血病患者有脾肿大、血细胞减少和循环毛细胞。在外周血涂片上，毛细胞呈中小淋巴细胞外观，具有周径“毛状”突起 {{exhibit_3}}。

（选项 F）霍奇金淋巴瘤患者通常表现为肿块（例如，纵隔肿块、淋巴结肿大）。循环肿瘤细胞的发现极为罕见。组织学上，Reed-Sternberg 细胞具有特征性。这些是大细胞，具有丰富的嗜碱性细胞质和 ≥2 个核叶或核 {{exhibit_4}}。

（选项 G）传染性单核细胞增多症患者有疲劳、淋巴结肿大和脾肿大。血小板减少症可能是这种感染的并发症。外周血涂片将显示少量循环异型淋巴细胞，而非大量原始细胞 {{exhibit_5}}。

教育目标：
Auer 小体（未成熟髓细胞前体内的线状紫红色包涵体）的发现有助于诊断急性髓细胞白血病。在急性淋巴细胞白血病中未发现 Auer 小体。在慢性髓细胞白血病中，存在更多成熟细胞和更少原始细胞 {{exhibit_6}}。{{exhibit_7}}

summary.en:
This question tests the ability to recognize acute myeloid leukemia (AML) based on peripheral blood smear findings, specifically the presence of Auer rods. It also requires knowledge of the typical presentation of AML and differentiating it from other hematologic malignancies.

To solve this question, first identify the key findings: pancytopenia (anemia, thrombocytopenia), leukocytosis, and blast cells with Auer rods on peripheral smear. Recognize that Auer rods are pathognomonic for AML and rule out other options based on their typical presentations and smear findings.
summary.zh:
此题考察根据外周血涂片结果（特别是 Auer 小体的存在）识别急性髓细胞白血病 (AML) 的能力。它还需要了解 AML 的典型表现，并将其与其他血液恶性肿瘤区分开来。

要解决此问题，首先确定关键发现：全血细胞减少（贫血、血小板减少症）、白细胞增多以及外周血涂片中带有 Auer 小体的原始细胞。认识到 Auer 小体是 AML 的病理征象，并根据其典型表现和涂片结果排除其他选项。
